meanings.definition: A strong negative reaction by a large number of people, especially to a social or political development.
meanings.sent1: The community faced a backlash after the controversial decision.
meanings.sent2: The backlash against the new law was intense.
meanings.sent3: The backlash over the cancelled event led to many heated discussions.
meanings.sent4: Her words caused a backlash that reverberated throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The backlash was so powerful, it changed the course of the debate.

meanings.definition: A sudden backward motion or springing back.
meanings.sent1: The backlash of the door surprised him.
meanings.sent2: The backlash of the elastic band hit his hand.
meanings.sent3: The backlash of the slingshot made him jump.
meanings.sent4: The backlash of the trampoline sent him flying higher.
meanings.sent5: The backlash of the spring was stronger than expected.
